news_list.title: The last caste census was in 1931. A look back at its findings
news_list.description: The Union Cabinet Committee on Political Affairs (CCPA) has announced that it will launch a caste census in India, the first such exercise since the 1901 Census was conducted by the colonial British government and is being carried out by the Congress-led UPA government for more than 20 years. It is not yet clear how many votes castes have been counted in the 1931 census, but some of them are expected to be taken into account.

news_list.title: Transgender women footballers barred from playing in women’s game in UK
news_list.description: Transgender women will be barred from playing in England’s women’s football on June 1 if they are not registered transgender players, the Football Association has announced. The decision comes after a ruling that the term “woman” refers only to a biological woman. It comes on the back of the ruling from Britain’s supreme court that the word “woman" in the Equality Act refers solely to an asexual woman.

news_list.title: NEET UG 2025: Things candidates need to avoid in last few days
news_list.description: Don’t compare your NEET UG preparation. Practice what you already know. Do not compare yourself to other people. Be prepared for the exam. Stay away from junk foods. Avoid taking bulky notes on the day of the NEET U exam. Take time to calm yourself down before the exam, and don’t discuss questions with other people in the exam hall. Remain calm and watch out for any mistakes or mishaps.

news_list.title: Room with a view: At 2026 Asian Games, athletes to stay at ‘Floating Village’ on board luxury cruise liner
news_list.description: Aichi-Nagoya Asian Games organisers decided against constructing a brand-new Athletes Village to cut costs . Instead of the usual brick-and-mortar buildings that make the Athletes’ Village, approximately 4,600 athletes will be housed in a luxury cruise liner that will be docked at Japan’s shipping hub Nagoya . The floating Games Village will be based at the Kinjo Pier in Nagoya Port and will include a balcony with an ocean view .

It has been given a deadline of 120 days to earmark the boundaries of the borough.
